avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last few days sometimes large wind slabs formed especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. These can be released by a single winter sport participant.
As a consequence of solar radiation more dry and moist avalanches are possible as the day progresses, but they can reach medium size. This applies in particular in steep rocky terrain.

Careful route selection and spacing between individuals are recommended.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs represent the main danger. Caution is to be exercised in particular on steep east facing slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface. This applies in particular on shady slopes as well as at high altitude.
The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. This applies in particular on near-ridge east facing slopes.
The old snowpack is well consolidated. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall from the afternoon. Light snowfall above approximately 1400 m.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In the last two days avalanche prone wind slabs formed especially above approximately 2000 m. These can be released, even by small loads in isolated cases. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude the avalanche danger is one level higher.
Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger.

As a consequence of solar radiation more small and medium-sized moist avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on rocky sunny slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Towards its surface, the snowpack is soft and has a loosely bonded surface. This applies in particular on shady slopes as well as at high altitude.
The moderate wind has transported the new snow. This applies in particular on near-ridge east facing slopes.
The old snowpack is well consolidated. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall from the afternoon. Light snowfall above approximately 1400 m.

avalancheActivity.comment: In the last two days mostly small wind slabs formed especially adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. These can be released, even by small loads in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in particular on east facing slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The moderate wind has transported the new snow. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with each other and the old snowpack.
The old snowpack is well consolidated.
Above approximately 2100 m a lot of snow is lying.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall from the afternoon. Light snowfall above approximately 1400 m.

avalancheActivity.comment: In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas rather small wind slabs formed. Caution is to be exercised in particular in extremely steep shady starting zones at high altitude. Even a small avalanche can sweep snow sport participants along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack will be generally stable.

snowpackStructure.comment:
The old snowpack is well consolidated and its surface has a strong melt-freeze crust. In some cases the wind slabs have bonded poorly with the old snowpack.
In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

tendency.comment: Some snow will fall from the afternoon. Light snowfall above approximately 1400 m.
